greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array of permutations: A(row,col) = A249822(row+1, A249821(row, col)), read by antidiagonals A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), ...
comment: These are the "first differences" between permutations of array A249822, in a sense that by composing the first k rows of this array [from right to left, as in a(n) = row_k(...(row_2(row_1(n))))], one obtains row k+1 of A249822.

On row n the first non-fixed term is A250474(n+1) at position A250474(n), i.e., on row 1 it is 5 at n=4, on row 2 it is 9 at n=5, on row 3 it is 14 at n=9, etc. All the previous A250473(n) terms are fixed.
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: ;; Code for A249821bi and A249822bi given in A249821, A249822.
xref: Inverse permutations can be found from array A251721.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 07 2014
